thread.title: American Express to report first-quarter earnings after the market close

title: American Express to report first-quarter earnings after the market close
text:
Breaking News Mike Kemp | Contributor | Getty Images 
American Express shares rose 2.5 percent after the company reported first-quarter earnings that beat estimates on Wednesday. 
The results were its first since CEO Stephen Squeri took the helm of the company in February. 
AmEx has spent heavily on rewards to lure customers as it faces more competition from banks like J.P. Morgan Chase and Citigroup . 
Here are the results: 
—EPS: $1.86, compared to an estimate of $1.71 from Thomson Reuters 
—Revenue: $9.72 billion, compared to an estimate of $9.46 billion, according to Thomson Reuters 
In January, former CEO Ken Chenault said AmEx will suspend its buyback program for the first half of the year to rebuild its capital because of an upfront charge triggered by the new tax law. 
This story is developing. Please check back for further updates.
